page.title: 08Ettingshall linear walk
page.content: The old community of Ettingshall has a mixture of industrial and housing land- cover. There is little open space so when the local railway line was closed it provided an opportunity to develop the ecology of the area. The tracks were taken up,the land covered with gravel to make it usable in all weathers and a new access was made by the building of steps down to the line. Walking along the new footpath you can hardly believe that you are in such a densely populated urban area. Its lower location blots out traffic noise. Birds can be easily seen and heard, including Kestrels. As the old (GWR) line here was in a cutting the steep sides have been colonised by many wild flowers and bushes which make this a most pleasant walk and an addition to the amenities of the area.
